laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially 109 mmol/liter (9670 mg/dl) and decreased acutely by 60–85% per procedure.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Rebounded to baseline values within 7 days after exchange. Estimated volume of distribution for triglycerides was 2.2 liters, consistent with extracellular distribution.
Decreased by 60-85% during acute plasma exchange; returned to preapheresis values within 7 days.

laboratory_examinations.findings: HDL cholesterol was reported as 0.54 mmol/liter (21 mg/dl).
Initially 9%, lowered to 8.6% within the first 40 procedures and maintained between 8.3% - 8.8% for the remainder.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased from 9.6% to 8.6% within the first 40 procedures.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) ranged from 62-98 U/liter (normal, 0-41 U/liter) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) from 35-135 U/liter (normal, 0-35 U/liter).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Nadir prepheresis ALT and AST concentrations were 26 and 16 IU/liter, respectively.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated at 579 pmol/liter (80.7 U/ml; normal 4-20 U/ml).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased from 81 U/ml (581 pmol/liter) to 47 U/ml (337 pmol/liter).
